home.name: Lucila V. Kendziur
home.resume: Hi! I'm Lu, a front-end developer from Argentina. I stand out for developing user interfaces accessible to everyone. I love to face challenges that allow me to learn a little more every day. Teamwork, code documentation, and accessibility are three very important pillars of my work.
home.card-description-1: In addition to being a programmer, I have a degree in Political Science from the National University of Rosario.
home.card-description-2: I discovered my passion for systems in college, doing the functional part of an app.
home.card-description-3: I like cats a lot. Saul and Sultan are my great office companions.

about.title: About
about.description: I started in the world of software development in 2021 as a NetSuite Developer, which allowed me to have a very strong foundation in vanilla JavaScript and understand the close relationship between client and server. In 2022 I decided to take on a new challenge in the development world and so I started working as a Frontend Developer, creating accessible user-centric interfaces. As a developer, I like to ensure the quality of code delivery, documentation, and the well-being of the team.

project.title: Projects
project.description: This section shows my most recent projects. They are personal projects that I develop in my free time and allow me to learn new tools that I use in my work. What I show, is a small part of everything I can do. In each project, you will find a description of the project, the design patterns used, and the technologies used.

contact.title: Contact
contact.description: We can keep in touch by email or you can send me a message through this form. Also, I invite you to stay connected and learn more about my work through LinkedIn.
contact.form-email-format: Entered value does not match email format
